name: Terrapin 3
description: Terrapin 3 is a Logo programming environment for Apple II(2)

commands.description: Changes the vertical scale at which Logo graphics are drawn.  Takes one numeric input and uses this to change the scale factor

Breaks out of Logo into the Apple monitor.  (For use in Logo system debugging only.)  Useful entry addresses are 1Bf9, which is a cold start address to use after Logo...  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n493/mode/2up?view=theater
Calls a machine code subroutine in memory.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n493/mode/2up?view=theater
Returns a list of all words known to Logo.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n493/mode/2up?view=theater
Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n485/mode/2up?view=theater
Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n485/mode/2up?view=theater
Prints the names of files on the current mounted disk
Clears the character input buffer.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n489/mode/2up?view=theater
Closes the open file.  All output will be written to the file
Resumes execution after a PAUSE, CTRL-Z.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n491/mode/2up?view=theater
Outputs horizontal position
Outputs a list.  The first element is the cursor's horizontal position, and second, its vertical position
Outputs vertical position
Removes from the disk a file saved with SAVE.  Takes file name as input, which must begin with a " mark

Takes a name as input and removes that name from the library.  Signals an error if the name is not used.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n485/mode/2up?view=theater

Takes a word as input and transfers to the line with the label.  You can only GO to a label within the same procedure.  Labels are defined by typeing them at the beginning of the indicated line followed by a colon.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n487/mode/2up?view=theater
Clears workspace and restarts Logo
Restores the normal mode of white-on-black
commands.reason: PenNormal is the most similar command in WebLogo but a little different.  penNormal affects the pen state only.  It won't set the screen color or fill color which is

commands.description: Turns off tracing
Takes a file name as input.  The input to dprint will be printed into the Logo file with this name

Stops execution and allows command lines to be evaluated in the current local environment.  Equivalent to interrupt character CTRL-Z.  Execution is resumed with CONTINUE provided no errors have occured.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n491/mode/2up?view=theater
Like print but does not terminate output line with a return.

If given a procedure name as input, prints out the text of the procedure.  If given no input, prints out the last procedure defined, edited or printed out.  ore at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n491/mode/2up?view=theater
Prints the contents of the editor on the printer.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n499/mode/2up?view=theater
Reads a file from disk.  Destroys any graphics display.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n499/mode/2up?view=theater
Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n489/mode/2up?view=theater
Reads a picture from disk and displays it to the graphics screen.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n491/mode/2up?view=theater
Causes the contents of the editor to be stored on disk in the  Logo file with the specified file name
Prints the contents of the file on the screen
Tests a condition to be used in conjunction with iftrue and iffalse.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n487/mode/2up?view=theater
Used with if... then... else...

Aborts the current procedure and all calling procedures and returns control to toplevel, its not used very often in Logo programming.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n487/mode/2up?view=theater

Takes no input.  Causes Logo to pause before continuing each procedure, and print the name of the procedure and its inputs.  Typing any character other than CTRL-G, or CTRL-Z will cause Logo to go on to the next line.  Typing CTRL-G will cause Logo to abort to toplevel.  CTRL-Z will pause and space will continue execution.  Learn more at https://archive.org/details/TerrapinLogo3.0ForAppleII/page/n491/mode/2up?view=theater

keywords.description: Terminates a procedure definition that is typed in to the editor.  It is not necessary to type END at the end of the final definition.  But if you are defining more than one procedure at a time, the separate procedure definitions must be separated by END statements.
